description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the remote code execution vulnerability associated with the Microsoft WDAC OLE DB Provider for SQL Server (CVE-2024-21441), it is essential to apply the relevant security updates.

1. Identify and download the following KB updates based on your system configuration:
   - For Windows Server 2022, apply KB-5035857 and KB-5035959.
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2, apply KB-5035853.
   - For Windows Server 2019, apply KB-5035849.
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2, apply KB-5035845.
   - For Windows 10 for 32-bit systems, apply KB-5035858.

2. Visit the Microsoft Update Catalog at the links provided to access the updates.
3. Follow the installation instructions for each update to ensure they are properly applied.
4. Restart your system to finalize the installation of the updates.

**Details**:
- The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code remotely if certain conditions are met.
- Ensure that your system is fully backed up before proceeding with applying updates.
- For additional details, you can find more information on the updates at: [Microsoft Update Catalog](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035845), [KB5035858](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035858), [KB5035853](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035853), and [KB5035854](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035854).
